description: EUBAM was launched in 2005 at the joint request of the Presidents of Moldova and Ukraine. It provides on-the-job training and advice to border officials, reinforcing their capacity to carry out effective border and customs controls and surveillance.

subproject.description: The overall objectives of the project launched at the joint request of the Presidents of Moldova and Ukraine are to contribute to enhancing the overall border and customs management capacities and the abilities of Moldova and Ukraine to fight against cross-border and organized crime and to approximate the standards of the border and law enforcement authorities to those of the EU; to assist Moldova and Ukraine in fulfilling their commitments under the European Neighbourhood Policy Action Plans (ENP AP) and the Partnership and Cooperation Agreements (PCA); and to contribute to a peaceful resolution of the Transnistria conflict.
subproject.gender code: No noticeable contribution to gender equality
subproject.title: EUBAM6

subproject.title: EUBAM8

subproject.description: The European Union Border Assistance Mission to Moldova and Ukraine aims at enhancing the border and customs management capacities of Moldova and Ukraine to fight against cross-border and organised crime and to approximate the standards of the border and law enforcement authorities to those of the EU. It assists Moldova and Ukraine in fulfilling their commitments under the European Neighbourhood Policy Action Plans (ENP AP) and strives to contribute to a peaceful resolution of the Transnistria conflict.
